channel.title: Finance
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from Finance, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Exclusive: Airwallex crosses $1 billion in annualized revenue as fintech unicorn takes on U.S. competitors like Ramp and Stripe
item.description: Airwallex cofounder and CEO Jack Zhang says the company is growing 90% year-over-year after expanding into the U.S. and Europe.

item.title: Trump takes center stage at APEC–yet Asia’s business leaders are optimistic that multilateralism will prevail
item.description: Also: All the news and watercooler chat from Fortune.

item.title: Your Tree On Battersea: Apple Opens iPad Drawing Competition
item.description: Apple’s Christmas Tree event at Battersea Power Station, this year will be a U.K.-wide competition inviting trees drawn on iPad.

item.title: Universal Announces 4K Blu-Ray Ultimate Collector’s Editions Of ‘Scarface’ And [Checks Notes] ‘Five Nights At Freddy’s’
item.description: The quality of the films might not exactly be the same, but Universal’s presentation for both these new releases is equally high.

item.title: Xi quips about backdoors during Xiaomi phone gift to Korea’s Lee
item.description: Xi, in South Korea to meet Trump on the sidelines of the APEC summit, presented the pair of smartphones to Korean President Lee Jae Myung.

item.title: Trump’s Gutting Of The Consumer Financial Protection Bureau Is Leaving The Public Vulnerable To Abuses
item.description: A massive dismantling of the financial regulator created to protect consumers is underway, affecting everything from auto lending and digital payments...

item.title: How New Research Is Changing What We Know About The Great Hammerhead
item.description: The great hammerhead (Sphyrna mokarran) — one of the ocean’s most iconic predators — is in deeper peril than once thought. Once believed to roam vast ...

item.title: For now, data ignorance is bliss on Wall Street as investors are warned not to rely too heavily on private surveys
item.description: "The danger with this data is that its message will be given unwarranted credibility by the absence of proper economic data," said UBS's chief economi...

item.title: Bang & Olufsen Launches Reloved To Give A Second Life To Its Classic Danish Audio Products
item.description: The luxury audio brand from Denmark is celebrating its centenary and has announced the launch of a dedicated website selling refurbished B&O classic p...

item.title: Hegseth reaffirms Vietnam partnership and hands over a leather box, belt and knife—wartime artifacts taken by U.S. soldiers
item.description: “Today we will exchange artifacts and information from the war with the goal of helping family members in both countries find peace.”

item.title: Largest US airlines raise pressure on Dems to 'pass a clean CR' and end shutdown
item.description: Major U.S. airlines are calling on Congress to reopen the government as TSA workers and air traffic controllers are continuing to work without pay.

item.title: Obamacare prices are set to spike – here's why

item.title: BlackRock's Larry Fink says US still top destination for global investors to park money
item.description: BlackRock CEO Larry Fink said the U.S. will remain the top investment destination as money flows back up into American assets amid the AI surge and th...

item.title: Mortgage rates fall for fourth consecutive week, lowest level in over a year
item.description: The average rate on the 30-year fixed mortgage fell this week to 6.17%, according to the latest Freddie Mac data released on Thursday. That is down fr...

item.title: Reid Hoffman Raises $24.6 Million for AI Cancer-Research Startup
item.description: The LinkedIn co-founder is starting Manas AI with “The Emperor of All Maladies” author Siddhartha Mukherjee.

item.title: Tech, Media & Telecom Roundup: Market Talk
item.description: DeepSeek, SoFi and more in the latest Market Talks covering Technology, Media and Telecom.

item.title: Silicon Valley Is Raving About a Made-in-China AI Model
item.description: DeepSeek is called “amazing and impressive” despite working with less-advanced chips.

item.title: What to Know About China's DeepSeek AI
item.description: The Chinese upstart says it has trained high-performing AI models cheaply, without using the most advanced chips.

item.title: Can an App Replace a Personal Trainer? I Tested Nearly a Dozen to Find Out
item.description: Apps can add flexibility and freshness to your routine. Just try not to get injured.
